result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Howe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 15 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Violent Contact with the vicitm or any individual. Maintain absolute sobriety. Any valid prescripton drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L. Howe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated 08/22/15
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher L. Howe in court with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant entered a plea of no contest to count 2. Court conducted plea colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant guilty of count 2. Court dismissed and read-in count 1. Victim presented statements to the court. 
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

TERM OF PROBATION:  12 MONTHS  WITHHELD
CREDIT - 15 days if Revoked. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No violent contact with: the victim and any individual.

COSTS:  $343.00  includes $100.00 DV surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher L. Howe in court with Attorney Sam Benedict for Attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Benedict states that Defendant has completed counseling but Attorney Benedict states that Attorney Masnica has not been able to speak with charging district attorney.  Court adjourns.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher L. Howe in court with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Erik J Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masnica states that Defendant is still enrolled in counseling.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on May 21, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Hearing on May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher L. Howe in court with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masnica requests and adjournment as Defendant is in treatment.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on March 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint or any family member.    Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Christopher L. Howe in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Atty Masnica requests a bail modification.  State has no objection to modification.  Victim makes a statement on the record.  The court amends cash bail to signature bond.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Attorney Masnica
Preliminary hearing on February 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher L. Howe in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario for attorney Nicole Masnica who will be appointed on Friday, January 20, 2014.   Erik Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on January 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher L. Howe
Current: 515 West Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-28-2014)
Prior: 2005 Dixie Dr,#2, Waukesha, WI 53189

Absolute sobriety. Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Take all prescriptions as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in criminal complaint or her residence, and no violent contact with any family members. Defendant must report his current address within 48 hours of release from custody.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Christopher L. Howe in court, in custody, with attorney Anfin Jaw.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defendant is able to stay at his mother's home, but does not have her address. Defendant must report his current address within 48 hours of release from custody. Attorney Jaw requests status of counsel hearing.  Court grants. Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.  Hearing scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
